I invented file_get_contents()

so you don't need to tell me about it.

The whole point of this post is in showing how to iterate over the lines of a file using built-in functions.

Big files

As Richard wrote foreach (file()) is nice for small files but using it with bigger files doesn't look like the right way to me...

Big files part 2

It makes more sense to do foreach with large files.

If you have a standard setup with a 8MB default limit in php you can not do file_get_contents with any file over 8MB so this method makes a lot more sense.

file_get_contents should really only be used with smaller files your going to handle quickly or where total memory usage of a script is not a issue.
To answer your question: that's very sexy.

bad performance?

This is just to point out that if you compressed this in so little lines, there is a high risk that file('something') gets evaluated on every foreach step; with natural performance drawbacks coming..
